title: Kenya: Redtape Hampers Uptake of Business Loans
text:
Kenya: NTSA to Press Charges Against Kendu Bay Crash Car Owner 
Most investors who attended the summit last week were scouting for start-up businesses, it emerged. The local business community has urged government to end the bureaucracy in availing capital for the youth, women and persons with disabilities. 
The government allocated a total of Sh1.65 billion in this year's budget for business loans to youth and women. 
"Some of these foreigners said if Kenyans are investing in themselves then we don't mind to co-invest," Bidco Africa Group chief executive officer Vimal Shah said adding "the summit opened up a whole door for capital." 
Over Sh100 billion was committed for the small and medium enterprises at GES 2015. 
Enterprise development Cabinet secretary Adan Mohamed said the commitment by investors at the summit presents a significant opportunity for entrepreneurs. 
"We have picked the suggestion that foreign investors want see local investors taking the risk of putting money first and we see it as a legitimate issue," he said. Kenya
